did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: East German art collection,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: East German art collection. M0772. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The collection was put together by Jurgen Holstein, a Berlin bookseller. He included different internal views of East German art including the central establishment and allied artists, socialist aesthetics, collections devoted to approved artists, unusual topics (postcards, science fiction), material culture, and artists active during the 1980s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Books, catalogs, posters, and ephemera documenting the history of East German art. The largest segments of the collection are KUNSTLERKATALOGE (411 titles), catalogs of exhibits held in East Berlin (174 titles), and catalogs of exhibits held elsewhere in the GDR (285 titles). The remainder of the collection is divided into thematic areas: Kunstgewerbe, Buchwesen und Gebrauchsgrafik, Plakatliterature, Foto un Film, Kunsttheorie und Kunst politik, Architektur, Plastik und Bildhauer, and Allgemeines, each with between 27 and 98 titles.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Art, Modern--East Germany--20th century.
